title: (10004) Cáceres - 1D Calle Lope de Vega
description: Near the historic center. The entrance is at the corner of these streets: - calle Lope de Vega - calle José Reveriego Pedrazo Parking for about 6 motorhomes next to the free service area (provide a 34/36 adapter). Busy parking near parking for cars and buses.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 29 Calle Agustina de Aragón
description: Parking place near the center (12 minutes walking), between trees. Without services and with the road next to it, it is a bite noisy

title: (10004) Cáceres - Av. de las Delicias
description: Ample paved parking in front of the cemetery. Slightly sloping, with plenty of parking spaces. At the moment there is no ban. Distance to the center 15 minutes walking. Some noise from traffic from the next street. No services.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 2 Avenida de la Universidad
description: Small motorhome parking. Black and grey water. 900m from Plaza Mayor. 24 hr limit on parking.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 1 Camino Fuente Corchito
description: Wide street where it is allowed to park and spend the night by the local police since the nearby area is usually full. very quiet area

title: (10004) Cáceres - 1 Avenida de Extremadura
description: Laundrette open 365 jours

title: (10004) Cáceres - 14 Avenida de la Universidad
description: Auto gas LPG

title: (10004) Cáceres - 13 Calle Juan Ramón Marchena
description: Quiet residential area to spend the night. Nearby urban bus stops. Easy access. Good incorporation to motorways. They take motorhomes of any size. Nearby playgrounds

title: (10003) Cáceres - 13a Carretera de la Montaña
description: Parking for 5 or 6 cc on a slope 12 minutes from the city center by walking. Garbage cans available and a nice view of the old town. The cleanliness is not there but it is clearly that the other car parks located 20 minutes from the plaza mayor.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 34 Avenida de Hernán Cortés
description: Park of the prince's park, a very nice place surrounded by nature. Also very close to the center of Cáceres. In addition it is next to the municipal swimming pool. And playground for children.

title: (10004) Cáceres - Ronda Norte
description: Commercial place Quiet during the night.

title: (10003) Cáceres - 17 Ronda de San Francisco
description: Free, secure parking until 10 p.m. for small camper buses

title: (10003) Cáceres - Avenida el Brocense
description: Close to Sports City, Cultural Center and Hospital. Wide and quiet place at night. Near the center and bus stops.

title: (10001) Cáceres - 26 Calle Sanguino Michel
description: Express laundry.

title: (10002) Cáceres - 4 Avenida de la Hispanidad
description: Near downtown, bus stops, shops and restaurants. Quiet during the night.

title: (10003) Cáceres - Ctra de la Montaña
description: Place with beautiful views of the city, close to the city. We have spent a very quiet night, there are usually almost no cars. It is uphill, for us it has not been a problem.

title: (10005) Cáceres - 22 Avenida de la Hispanidad
description: Perfect place to tour the city, just keep in mind the bus stop.

title: (10005) Cáceres - 2 Calle Grecia
description: Free parking, quiet to spend the night or visit the city

title: (10005) Cáceres - 2 Avenida Pierre de Coubertin
description: Free asphalted parking, quiet to spend the night or visit the city

title: (10005) Cáceres - 5116 Avenida de las Arenas
description: Near Amburgueseria, gas station and Carrefour. Bus stop. Quiet and spacious place.

title: (10005) Cáceres - 1 Calle Cueva del Conejar
description: Nearby supermarket Maxi Dia, gas station, Health Center. Quiet place and with nearby bus stops.

title: (10003) Cáceres - 52 Sierra de la Montaña
description: It is the highest point in the city, nobody bothers you at night and in the morning. We stayed two nights and it is a good place with stunning views of Cáceres.

title: (10005) Cáceres - 6B Poligono SUP13
description: Very quiet residential area with ample on-line parking. 25 minutes from the historic center. Very quiet and little traffic. Nearby there is a bar and gardens.

title: (10003) Cáceres - 91 Calle Juan Sebastián Bach
description: Water filling fountain (with push button). It is also possible to park since it is a residential area and is very quiet.

title: (10195) Cáceres - 3 Calle Azucena
description: Great to stay overnight, the place is quiet and calm in a residencial area with lots of space. It’s surrounded by a urban park, great for a walk.

name: Camping Cáceres
title: (10001) Camping Cáceres
description: Camping Cáceres with camper pitches and private sanitary facilities on each pitch! with toilet, shower, sink and water hose for filling mobile homes. Restaurant, grocery store, laundry, pool 11am to 7pm. Dogs are allowed WiFi free. Open-air discotheque next door open on Saturdays. Could only be heard very quietly

title: (10195) Cáceres‎ - Carr. de Mérida
description: In the fair of Cáceres a lot of shade, ideal to rest very calm

title: (10004) Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in service near a restaurant and overlooking the dam Guadiloba. We made a picnic stop .. very calm .. possibility of spending the night. a pedestrian path allows the tower of the dam.

title: (10004) Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description:
By a water reservoir. Peaceful and wonderful views, especially for bird watchers!  Okay only wifi wise. Easy access for all during the dry months.

Keep it clean, thank you.

title: (10181) Sierra de Fuentes - N-521
description: Rest area.

title: (10004) (Campus Universitario) - Unnamed Road
description: Magnificent spot at the water's edge of the dam. The view is superb on the lake and the steppe-type landscape! Absolute silence flat and stable ground.

title: (10004) Cáceres -
description: Place next to the Guadiloba reservoir. There is no type of service but it is a quiet place next to the water. Overhang next to the road. Level.

title: (10004) Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place by the lake in a quiet area with a beautiful view of the lake, no garbage cans, no services very clean places, a few cyclists and walkers during the day, after the dam there is a small climb which is not in very good condition not recommended in a motorhome and low vehicle, I went there with a 6m van no problem

title: (10004) Sierra de Fuentes -
description: On the other side of the lake by the fairly correct dirt track, perfect spot for calm, the view, the setting sun and the very beautiful nature at the beginning of spring, it feels a bit like being in Ireland!!

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - CC-38
description: Passage area with large car parks. Very close to the money highway. Ideal for a night trip.

title: (10181) Sierra de Fuentes - Unnamed Road
description: Small parking lot at a hermit. Good for an overnight stay. Great prospects ...

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - Calle de los Cuatro Lugares
title_short: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - Calle de los Cuatro Lugares
description: Motorway services. Large restaurant with showers and toilet. Children’s play park and ample parking. Good option for an overnight stop.

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 3 Zona Extrerradio
description: Parking of the bullring. It is not asphalted. Avoid the time of pilgrimages. Very calm. 1km from the urban center. Without services

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 138 Pasaje Monte del Casar
title_short: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 138 Pasaje Monte del Casar
description: Quiet place for the night

title: (10195) Cáceres - Camino de Aldea del Cano
title_short: (10195) Cáceres - Camino de Aldea del Cano
description: If you are looking for a place without people, next to a small pond, there is nothing better!

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 85 Ronda de la Charca
title_short: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 85 Ronda de la Charca
description: Green area next to the "pond" very nice for a stop with goals and baskets and street parking swings. Good town to buy cheeses.

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 14 Calleja Charca
description: Urban location with views of the lake, not very busy. Quiet place to spend the night but with some traffic. There are no services.

title: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - 91 Calle C
description: Ample parking very quiet with night lighting and noise. rather leveled place and surrounded by nature to the south. A few meters from a repair shop for motor homes, caravans and campers as well as selling products for toilets, bottles and cartridges for gas and camping in general. We were allowed to fill the cleanup tank when purchasing a chemical toilet product. easy location and just 3 km from the highway. The police go through the night doing their surveillance round and never told us anything. very close to LOS BARRUECOS parage where they recorded scenes of game of thrones.

title: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 117 Calle Larga Baja
title_short: (10190) Casar de Cáceres - 117 Calle Larga Baja
description: Concrete area under trees. It is at the end of the village, next to a hermit and several fences with animals, it is a quiet area. We were several hours and without problems.

title: (10005) Cáceres - N-630
description: Motorway rest area (without services - only drinking water) Gasoil, LPG, Water, Tire pressure, Small grocery store, Parking to be shared with heavy goods vehicles, Restaurant correct for the place. Good for a night on the (Madison) road to Algedira.

title: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - Camino de Aldea del Cano
title_short: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - Camino de Aldea del Cano
description: Nobody, even in high season in my opinion. Between the dirt road frequented by a few farmers and the pastures of the cows where there is a small lake.

title: (10195) - 140 Finca Casa Minero
description: Gravel area reasonably flat some big potholes. Good late night stop, next to fuel garage and restaurant.

title: (10910) - 50 Calle Muñoz Torrero
description: Free motorhome parking to empty free, fill fee

title: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description: A nice quasi-flat gravel parking lot in the area of the granite cliffs los barruecos. the gate to the asphalt road is not far and the way is easy to drive with a 7 meter mobile home. the other parking spaces are not as flat and not so easy to reach with larger vehicles. we had drizzle, the sand paths quickly become slippery. the gate to the main street, next to the cattle fence, can be opened and closed by yourself so that you can drive in with the mobile home. we met a few local vehicles on a November evening, everyone gave a friendly greeting. we saw no signs prohibiting RVs or staying overnight. the granite rocks are incredibly beautiful. there was no water in the lakes when we visited in November. We could go for a great walk with our dogs, but be careful, there are cattle and many other animals, birds, toads, etc., so the dogs must always be on call or on a leash. for us a wonderful place in the middle of these magical granite rocks. sometimes even up to 3G reception.

title: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - 2 Calle Cinco
description: We had a very quiet night. It is in normal car parks near the road that goes to Los Barruecos. near restaurants. children's park. visit old town. pool and granite rocks.

title: (10164) Valdesalor (Cáceres) - Puente Viejo de la Mocha
title_short: (10164) Valdesalor (Cáceres) - Puente Viejo de la Mocha
description: Vast meadow spreading around el puente viejo of Mocha. A peaceful night of March. Picnic area, water, ornithological observatories...

title: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - 1 Extramuros Diseminados
description: Very quiet in a beautiful place, sunset on the rocks, do not hesitate to go through the portals without much indication which surely limits the size of motorhomes, no service

title: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - Vereda de Malpartida o del Lavadero de Lanas
title_short: (10910) Malpartida de Cáceres - Vereda de Malpartida o del Lavadero de Lanas
description: Ideal for the Los Barruecos route, it is a parking lot, there is no service. Only trash.

address.street: Vereda de Malpartida o del Lavadero de Lanas

title: (10910) Cáceres - 4 Diseminado la Estrella
description: Picnic area with grills, water fountains, dumpsters, and shade. Good place to stop and visit the Barruecos. Weekends full of visitors. Forbidden nights.

title: (10910) - 1 Extramuros Diseminados
description: Noon stop, departure hike to visit large rocks affected by erosion.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: At the edge of a pretty, super-quiet lake. Magnificent rocks, a quiet place, bird sanctuary.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Location of an old leisure center. The tables and benches are there, but in very bad condition. It seems to me possible to sleep there, but it's isolated.

title: (10164) Urbanización Zamarrilla -
description: Paradisiacal place in the middle of nature

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Around the idyllic little dam there are numerous parking spaces on the shore under eucalyptus trees with great views of the lake. Very quiet. At the beginning of June there hardly seems to be anyone here. A couple of fishermen can be made out. Recommendable

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Good place to spend the night, I traveled to Huelva for the night, some more van. many places in the shade and no people. the bad if you turn on moskitos light at night. normal in places with water

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Nice place to spend the night

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Fantastic and wonderful view of the lake! complete silence, many storks and herons, only to hear the bells of the sheep in the distance. One of our favorite places.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Concrete area between 4 olive trees. Great view of the somewhat dry lake. In the morning a flock of sheep came by. In sight is a neighbor with dogs barking in greeting ...

title: (10900) Arroyo de la Luz - EX-207
description: Very quiet place in the surroundings of a lagoon, good to spend the night, there are no shadows.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: We spent a weekend here in May. Lots of space and several options for parking. A couple of fishermen here for the day, and a shepherd walking by with his flock. Lots of herons, storks and ducks. Very peaceful. Tracks in quite good repair and a large waste bin so not to much litter around. No problems with our 7m sprinter van.

title: (10900) Arroyo de la Luz - CC-100
description: Quiet place close to the lake, sound of lapping water and waterbirds! just off the main road. Evidence of being used before (some litter). please take all litter away with you :)

title: (10195) Cáceres - Camino del Mortero
description: Near the river at the beginning of the sierra. Hiking trails. The descent from the road is not in good condition.

title: (10191) Santiago del Campo - 2 Camino Talaván
description: Quiet, close to the highway but little traffic

title: (10183) Torrequemada - 47 Calle Ejido
description: A spacious, quiet place with good access, next to a pond called the lower pond and a small playground with games. Several bars at the entrance and another very famous for its spectacular suckling pigs in the center of town. It is very interesting to visit the Ermita del Salor and Las Corralás on foot. The town is very quiet and the people are hospitable.

title: (10900) Arroyo de la Luz - 2 Lugar Valcajadillo
title_short: (10900) Arroyo de la Luz - 2 Lugar Valcajadillo
description: Shaded and quiet area, on the outskirts of the city, with a view of the lagoon. Only a trash can. Site in total autonomy, good for an overnight stopover.

title: (10191) Santiago del Campo - 3 Camino de Garrovillas
title_short: (10191) Santiago del Campo - 3 Camino de Garrovillas
description: Repsol service station on A66 / E803 between Cáceres and Salamanca. Behind the station, tire inflation station and free water point. Next to the station they have set up a cafeteria with showers (Very clean toilets). Ample space for parking

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Ctra. Ermita de Alta Gracia
title_short: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Ctra. Ermita de Alta Gracia
description: Picnic area adjoining the "hermita de la Virgen de Alta Gracia" isolated in the middle of the countryside typical of Extremadura. A few tables and dustbins. The two kind neighbours, "guardians" who hold the key, open the gates and doors for you. Easy access, north side, by a wide maintained track, partially asphalted, to be taken, on the right, between km 530 and 531 of the N630. Access on the south side will however be reserved for vans and small CCs, as the track sometimes has deep ruts and multiple potholes.

title: (10163) Aldea del Cano - 605 CC-71
description: It is a gas station where you can park and sleep. Much noise from the continuous coming and going of vehicles. There is a 24-hour cafeteria and a shop. It is near a town.

title: (10184) -
description: Beautiful place in the middle of nature, do not stay overnight, narrow path but with caution you can get there, there are picnic areas, without containers or water, free, very beautiful place, I just ask that it be just as clean

title: (10163) Aldea del Cano - 3 Calle Carretera
description: It has no service. We spent the night very quiet and ate in the bar, by the way we ate very well.

title: (10194) Monroy - C. Doña Carmen González
description: Water tap at back of hermitage

title: (10194) Monroy - 3 Calle Tálamo
description: Esplanade in an old silo at the entrance of the village. Five minutes from the square, from the town hall. You can visit the Church of Saint Catherine (XVI century) and the castle

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Carretera Ermita de Alta Gracia
title_short: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Carretera Ermita de Alta Gracia
description: Superb place in the middle of the fields, very quiet, just 2 or 3 cars per hour the day because located at the edge of a road very passable by car.

title: (10194) Monroy -
description: At first I parked at the hermitage but that area is obviously used extensively by the local fishermen and probably weekend drinking- continued along the dirt track through the gate which could easily fit my van - plenty of shade just have to pick your place and move with the sun ! Nice walk around the lake with plenty of birds

title: (10198) Santa Marta de Magasca - 7A Avenida España
title_short: (10198) Santa Marta de Magasca - 7A Avenida España
description: Area with picnic area and exercise machines. A little neglected the latter. Nice for a stop to coner / rest, maybe even stay overnight. There is hardly any passing of cars or noise.

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar -
description: In the middle of nature, right on the curve of the road with a descent, you can get there without problems

title: (10198) Santa Marta de Magasca - CC-99.1
description: Small parking area by bridge, visited by day but quiet at night, room for 2, beautiful

title: (10550) Aliseda -
description: Near a dry river bed in summer, superb view, a little road noise but super quiet and very beautiful site, accessible to all vehicles

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - N-630
description: Small parking place near the bridge, overlooking the reservoir. The short track from the road is a bit rough and steep, probably not suitable for large motorhomes

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Unnamed Road
description: Very quiet spot about 2km from main road along a poor tarmac road surrounded by nature and a reservoir

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar -
description: Place in the middle of nature on the heights of the lake. Unfortunately poorly maintained by visitors... Please respect the premises.

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - N-630
description: Nature all around, water views 270 degrees, magnificent sunset when arrived, quite night, no roads or lights nearby. No 4x4 needed just cars and Vans. Narrow way.There is a gate with a sign “close after you because of cattle” - we haven’t seen any though.

title: (10192) Hinojal - EX-373
description: Official parking area, as indicated by a sign on the road. Very picturesque rural parking with firm base. Well set off from the road, which is not busy. Away from it all.

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - N-630
description: Take the path on the left 500 m after the bridge going north, the start of which can be seen on the map. Dirt road not accessible to motorhomes, ideal for vans. We arrive at the lake in a fishing corner. Swimming and beautiful sunset. Come armed against mosquitoes because at dusk it's huge. Otherwise, calm night.

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Unnamed Road
description: Nice views over the reservoir, poor quality road (tarmac) for 2km from the main road but well worth the drive

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - N-630
description: Area at the camp near the abandoned station. No service, but OK for one night. Very strange and spooky. Out of sight of the road!

title: (10192) Hinojal - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
title_short: (10192) Hinojal - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
description: Incredibly beautiful under the bridge on the Rio Tajo. We and Vito for one night.

title: (10193) Talaván - 1 Camino Piscinas
description: Public parking. Pool side with bar / terrace and bathrooms. Typical Extremadura village. Church of the XV century and hermitage next to the pit. Old laundry room with super cool water

title: (10187) Albalá - Carretera a Albalá del Cau
title_short: (10187) Albalá - Carretera a Albalá del Cau
description: Place away from the village. With toilets, showers and fountain. Picnic tables and barbecue. Avoid romerias. Resurrection Sunday and first Sunday of May. Very calm. Place of concentration of caravans and motorhomes once a year

title: (10193) Talaván - 18 Calle Lavaderos
description: Talavan The place is next to some old laundries, called La Breña. There is fresh water and shops and bars nearby. The town has things to see and if you want to walk a path goes up to the Tagus, there is a hermitage and it takes about 40 '. You can also go with the car.

title: (10188) Botija - Unnamed Road
description: Lovely landscape of granite and oaks. Spacious parking. Guided tours can be arranged by calling the Botija Town Hall. It is worth it for the elderly and children. Overnight one night in Easter and without problems. We only heard visitors who came to the site in the morning.

title: (10930) Navas del Madroño - 51 Diseminado Navicera
description: Picnic area with a rich spring and overnight accommodation near the road. No faucet, watering can required. 1 pot full in 5 seconds. Large pool and benches.

title: (10550) Aliseda - 5 Calle Luis Buñuel
description: Ample parking without any kind of problem to spend the night and spend a weekend enjoying the wonderful gastronomy in Aliseda and surroundings with many trails and archaeological museums.

title: (10162) Casas de Don Antonio -
description: Newly installed spot outside of the village. Garbage cans behind the tennis court. Great basketball court, swimming pool (outdoor pool) in sight. Only drinking water, do not use the tap for the chemical toilets, transmission of faecal germs!

title: (10550) Aliseda - 6 Camino Pantano
description: Nice and quiet picnic with incredible views of the mountains of San Pedro and surroundings, with a great viewpoint, perfect to spend a great weekend and taste the cuisine of ALISEDA; there is an interpretation center, a mine and museum.

title: (10162) Casas de Don Antonio -
description: Nice little place to rest

title: (10930) Navas del Madroño - 43D Avenida de Extremadura
title_short: (10930) Navas del Madroño - 43D Avenida de Extremadura
description: Navarro del madroÑo caceres

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in the middle of nature, at the edge of the swamp of Alcantara, without shade, very quiet place, without services

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar -
description: In the Alcántara reservoir, with beautiful views of the sunset, a wonderful place to sleep

title: (10187) Albalá - 40 Calle Víctor Celestino Borreguero
description: Very quiet area Asphalted. Level and with beautiful views.

title: (10270) La Cumbre - CC-57.1
description: Place in the countryside near a very quiet road. Sunset and beautiful sunrise!

title: (10187) Albalá - 8 Calle Donantes de Sangre
description: Wide parking inside the village. With good access. No services, although there is a fountain nearby. Wifi of the house of culture (pass: library). Commerce nearby and three bars where you can eat. There are marked routes. The town is very quiet and hospitable people. It is not tourist, but it is the typical town in the middle of the pasture of Extremadura. Avoid during the festivities of the carnivals.

title: (10187) Albalá - 363 Diseminado Poligono 1 Numero
description: In ALbala, Place in beaten ground behind the hall of the village. Very calm place. Fountain to fill up with water.

title: (10940) Garrovillas de Alconétar -
description: Quiet parking next to the municipal pool. Shady trees.

name: Camping Las Grullas
title: (10185) Camping Las Grullas
description: Campsite Las Grullas. Naturist campsite. Excellent location, very peaceful and private. Thirty spaces and a chalet for rent. Electricity included. Water included and drinkable. Swimming pool and free wifi. Excellent facilities, well built and very clean. Very friendly owners who speak several European languages.

title: (10550) Aliseda - EX-303
description: Parking of the sanctuary of the virgin of the field. Very quiet, with trees and shade. More or less I call. There are bathrooms that are only open when mass is celebrated. On a high.

name: Camper Park Cáceres Nature
title: (10820) Camper Park Cáceres Nature
description: CAMPER PARK CÁCERES NATURE. Service area and overnight stay for motorhomes, caravans and campers in the middle of Vía de la Plata (motorway A-66), located in a unique environment close to Cáceres and National Park Monfragüe. It has 60m2 pitches, electricity, showers, washing machine, dryer, Wi-Fi, microwave, snack, food and drinks machine, daily bread and pastry service, picnic area, hiking trails, etc. Next to the swimming pools, restaurant, sports facilities and playpen. Petrol station, shops, bars and restaurants in the village. Reservations through the PVerde app.

title: (10170) Montánchez - Extrarradio Rivera Robledo
description: New newly paved parking lots. At the top they are more level. On the outskirts of the town in a very quiet place.

title: (10170) Montánchez - 16 Calle Juan Carlos I
description: In Montánchez (Cáceres), small area where you can park 2 motorhomes.

name: Camper stop Alegria
title: (10170) Camper stop Alegria
description: The motorhome area is easy to access. There are 20 spacious plots, we are located a very short distance from the center of Montánchez, a very special little town, located in the heart of Extremadura and known in Spain for its delicious Iberian ham. Montánchez also offers a very well preserved castle, dating from Roman times, located next to one of the most beautiful cemeteries in Spain. Due to its location at an altitude of 700 meters, it offers spectacular views of the landscape, which is why it is also known as the "Balcony of Extremadura". For more information, see the website

title: (10170) Montánchez - 24 Calle Taramilla
description: Very calm in the park of the very calm village. Must try Iberian ham is excellent

title: (10170) Montánchez - 1F Calle Floreta
description: Parking by the pool, at the starting point of hiking routes. completely flat and very quiet.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - 2 Calle Natividad Gabriel
description: A wide and very quiet street in the town of Alcuéscar in Cáceres.

title: (10820) Cañaveral - 1 Poblado Arco
description: It is an esplanade to spend the night quietly and with beautiful views of the Tagus River.

title: (10270) La Cumbre - 100 Avenida de la Constitución
title_short: (10270) La Cumbre - 100 Avenida de la Constitución
description: In a rural environment near the pool, shops, bars. Feast of the Patron Saint on August 15 on the square, every day events. Parties 20,21 and 22 do not miss it. Never seen anyone in cars and have a good time guaranteed.

title: (10199) Cáceres - Camino a Carmonita
description: Magical place like almost everyone here in Extremadura, reserved for 4x4 off-road vehicles because the road is narrow and winding, the game is worth the candle because the peace and the exclusivity of a place require sacrifices

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Unnamed Road
description: Ample parking behind the municipal swimming pools. Very calm. On the way to the pre-Romanesque church of Santa Lucía del Trampal, about 3 km away, which deserves a visit. Trash and glass containers.

title: (10820) Cañaveral - N-630
description: Green area next to the Hermitage of San Cristóbal, a transit area on the Camino De Santiago Vía de la Plata, perfect for stopping to eat and take a walk.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Unnamed Road
description: Perfect place to spend the night with a magnificent viewpoint. Place with little shade for summer.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - EX-382
description: National Highway 630- km.591, 10160 Alcuéscar. Next to the Repsol gas station. Good place to spend the night, Hostal Restaurante LOS OLIVOS, good food, shower. Ask Julio, good people.

title: (10820) Cañaveral -
description: Access by forest track exclusively van 4/2 - 4/4 edge of reconstituted forest pleasant wind to temper 33 degrees

title: (06487) Cordobilla de Lácara - Unnamed Road
description: More or less abandoned picnic area, with table and bins with a beautiful view of the lake, I stayed there the night without any problems, no prohibition signs, very quiet place rather clean place

title: (10291) La Aldea del Obispo -
description: We spent one night here. Cars pass occasionally in the evening and in the morning, but without any problems. Furthermore, only sounds of cattle and birds can be heard. An area where you can find and watch many species of birds. There are no amenities. Not far from the village of La Aldea del Obispo.

title: (06487) Cordobilla de Lácara - 55 Avenida Santitos
description: Place to park, near the lake and with stunning views. We believe that you can spend the night without problem

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Cordel de Mérida s/n
description: Campsite motorhome. max. number of places: 8 | max. camper length: 8m | max. length of stay: 3 weeks| Open: 1/1 - 31/12. price: - electricity, loading unloading waste water, washing machine, drinking water, wifi available at reception for a fee - call in advance - village 3km - close to the A66 exit 590. approach via the EX382 via Cordel de Mérida, Red gravel road entrance at wood company with yellow fences, after 900 meters on the cordel de Merida motorhome La Tierra Verde Holiday Accommodations

title: (06487) Cordobilla de Lácara - BA-099
description: Location near the road where you can park for a break with a good view of the reservoir. It is also a fishing area.

title: (10829) Pedroso de Acim - Unnamed Road
description: Nice location with great views. Only cows come to visit.

title: (10189) Zarza de Montánchez -
description: Zarza de Montanchez. Place in grass next to the sports center with good access, even for large AC. Ideal place to visit the neighboring oak of La Terrona, considered the oldest of the Iberian Peninsula.

title: (10828) Portezuelo - Calle Mesones
description: Nice place next to a lake. Children's games, fountains, barbecue, sports courts. Beautiful views of the castle. You can spend the night without problems, very quiet and without noise. You can drink water at the fountain next to the sports courts.

title: (10161) Arroyomolinos - CC-117
description: It is a picnic area with tables, under some trees that provide shade. and next to a pond with ducks. It is just at the edge of the Sierra de Montanchez. As a negative point, it is that it is close to the road. Although it is not very busy.

title: (06191) Puebla de Obando - Carretera Puebla de Obando
title_short: (06191) Puebla de Obando - Carretera Puebla de Obando
description: Shaded area, with picnic tables. Very quiet, away from the village, ideal for spending the night.

title: (06191) Puebla de Obando - km. 39 Calle Badajoz
title_short: (06191) Puebla de Obando - km. 39 Calle Badajoz
description: Repsol petrol station with drinking water point available.

title: (10829) Pedroso de Acim - EX-109
description: Small secluded fishing pond with sunset and sunrise. Alone in the world. Right on the main road, small access road.

title: (06191) Puebla de Obando - 105 Carretera Badajoz-Cáceres
description: Parking of a restaurant. Well, just for a lunch break

title: (06191) Puebla de Obando - 45 Calle Corta
description: Ok for a stopover on route north or south

title: (10540) Mirabel - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area To access it, you have to cross a Canadian step. There are picnic tables and plenty of shade

title: (10200) Trujillo - 3 Travesía Ramón y Cajal
description: Parking area very quiet day and night, without services.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Old rest area. Have chosen this place because the down spot on the road is only accessible by a path a little chaotic.

title: (10290) Trujillo - EX-208
description: Picnic area with spectacular views. It has nothing but picnic tables, but the setting is idyllic and is on the side of the road along the Tozo River. Quiet night. You can spend the night when you are outside the PN Monfragüe

title: (10291) - 25 Calle Alvarado
description: Huge slightly sloping parking with space for 20-25 caravans. Today the restaurant is abandoned and although it is close to the road, it does not have much traffic. the old parking lot of the place is very wide surrounded by field and semi-flat. Good to spend a night near Monfragüe

title: (10291) La Aldea del Obispo - EX-208
description: Quiet place in the nature with picnic table, located directly on the road (now and then a car passes by) but no direct view of the road. Just over 5km to the next village with supermarket and gas station (water). Perfect for a night ..

title: (10200) Trujillo - 5 Plaza Almagro
description: Quiet place to rest. That if area of many trees with many birds. Not recommended when trees are not pruned by large numbers of birds

title: (10380) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: At the foot of the bridge on Rio Almonte. About twenty km from the Monfrague National Park. Slope access but short slope. Can be difficult for large motorhomes, no problem with a van. Quiet, little passage on the road at night. We stayed 2 nights without problem.

title: (10200) Trujillo - 33D Carretera de Plasencia
description: Open place with picnic tables nearby. Possibility of staying overnight.

title: (10200) Trujillo - 0 Avenida Reina María Cristina
description: Parking for the day to visit the castle and the site with waste disposal

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Shaded parking at the edge of the road. Great motorhome without worries. No service.

title: (10879) Acehuche - 9 Trasera C Sotelo VIII
description: We were at the Las Carantoñas festival of national tourist interest. January 20. Very interesting. You have to come prepared to sleep little since many fireworks are thrown. In the morning they invite all attendees to crumbs... delicious!

title: (10200) Trujillo - 3 Calle Depósito
description: Next to Plaza Toros, a very quiet place to spend the night, we slept very well. The black water outlet does not have its own faucet, please do not use the clean water faucet. And very close to the center to visit the city. Thank you Trujillo for having such a site.

title: (06193) Badajoz - Camino de la Majada Nueva
title_short: (06193) Badajoz - Camino de la Majada Nueva
description: We stayed once during the night, it's okay, pure nature, the road does not bother

title: (10540) Mirabel - CC-29.5
description: Beautiful site at the foot of a castle, a few meters from the town of Mirabel, great view, you can visit the castle. . Perfect place to visit the monfrague natural park. Large birds of prey can easily be seen from this area. Enjoy it and take care of yourself.

title: (10530) Serradilla - CCV-29
description: New pull off to view over the surrounding countryside- next to road with some level area - fantastic view but don’t get too close to the edge with vehicles as chippings are still soft - probably ok for night but good for mid day stop as does have shade

title: (10530) Serradilla - 101 Calle Álamo
description: Close to shops, bars, Health Center, Interpretation Center and Guardia Civil Barracks. Quiet.

title: (10960) Villa del Rey -
description: Place to rest and spend the night. Quiet and silent. Small town outskirts.

title: (10530) Serradilla - Carretera Torrejón el Rubio
description: Parking next to the road. Illuminated. Bar-Restaurant, nearby.

title: (10530) Serradilla -
description: Quiet place next to the road. Fit one or two vans or motorhomes. Access is by unpaved road but in good condition. We spent two very quiet nights, there are a couple of stone tables next to it to eat, and it is very close to the viewpoint and the gorge of the friar. IMPORTANT To avoid going through the gate, it is better to go along the cemetery road. We with an L3H2 passed without problems. There is a small descent, which is carefully passed. Perhaps somewhat complicated for motorhomes.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Parking to spend the night on the edge of Monfrague park where camping is prohibited. Calm. Slightly sloping. Located at the exit of the city.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: On old piece of road and / or former park area, behind the hedge separating it from the road, beautiful view, due west. For van or small motorhome

title: (10132) Almoharín - 16 Calle UE-9
description: Parking in Almoharín. Famous place for its chocolate figs. The gray and black water can be emptied and it has 6 water intakes on the ground, under iron covers. The intakes are prepared for wide hoses. Very close to the Visigoth Basilica of Santa Lucía del Trampal. And also near the Sierra de Montánchez where the thousand-year-old oak La Terrona is located.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - Calle Calvo Sotelo
title_short: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - Calle Calvo Sotelo
description: Cemetery parking, water available at the tap inside. Ideal for the Monfragüe park

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - 25 Diseminado Barrio Corchito
title_short: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - 25 Diseminado Barrio Corchito
description: Next to the sports area of the municipality. Next to the wall of the pool it is very inclined, but in the green area that overlooks the football field it is good. There are no services but you are at the end of the town, so there will be places to buy bread or food. Very quiet night. Thanks to the municipality for allowing parking and spending the night (not camping).

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio -
description: This car park is inside the royal ravine of Torrejón el Rubio, a resting place for transhumant animals, perfect nights, to rest without noise (if the sheep are not there) and to see the stars and planets, with the astronomer Carlos, at night, very Well explained, from the South Visitor Center of Monfragüe, what is next. Yes, the door is closed, you can enter, park and the door will be left as it was. You can make routes to the Monfragüe natural reserve, before you have to go to the reserve office, which is in the town. According to all the Vilatans asked, yes, it is allowed to spend the day and the night; the answers, it is always the same, it is allowed. The cemetery parking lot is far from the town.

title: (10530) Serradilla -
description: Magnificent and secluded location facing Monfraguë Park. There are 3 stone tables and a shaded shelter. Possible to park in the middle for a car, quite steep passage. Otherwise two places just before on the roadside. There is no shortage of trash cans, we clean the site when we leave, keep it clean!! No wind as we passed despite the exposure.

title: (10530) Serradilla - Unnamed Road
description: Small esplanade next to a dirt road, quiet to spend the night. No services. Near the sculpture of the wolf.

title: (10540) Mirabel -
description: Service area and overnight stays in transit for motorhomes, caravans and motorhomes on the Vía de la Plata A-66. ideal for a stopover along the way. It has large plots with surveillance, electricity, emptying and filling service for motorhomes, toilets, showers, shop, restaurant, gas station. Supply service in transit with three hours of rest.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
title_short: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
description: Gas station and bar open 24 hours a day with vegetables. Possibility to rest and spend the night. We found trucks, vans and RVs staying overnight. Quieter in the back because there is a lot of noise from cars early in the morning.

title: (10829) Holguera - CC-S-4
description: Parking next to the municipal swimming pools and near the village. The pool bar has a very large covered terrace.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Place in the countryside, at the edge of a small river. Very quiet at night, some cars pass on the bridge (200 meters) from time to time. Otherwise, there is only the sound of water and the singing of frogs. Access by a steep stony path that is (may be) impressive for some vehicles but is done quite. Wedges could be a plus.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Small parking for up to two vehicles right by the main road going through the park. It is just outside the park so it is not forbidden to overnight there. Traffic noise at night as it is very close to the road. Nothing to do around. No walking possibilities.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: parking line next to the road, near the Salto del Gitano

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Ground parking at the base of the castle Natural Park Monfrague. Forbidden to sleep at night.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Saut du Gitan parking lot. Wonderful point of view, you can't spend the night there!

title: (10830) Torrejoncillo - Unnamed Road
description: Surroundings of a hermitage. Good views of the reservoir. Paved road and accessible to AC. Picnic area and some shade tree. It looks like a place to celebrate popular festivals, so be careful with the dates.

title: (10830) Torrejoncillo - 19 EX-109
description:
Quiet place to sleep at night with horses and cows on the fields arround.
park for the kids.

title: (06486) La Nava de Santiago - 26 Avenida de la Laguna
title_short: (06486) La Nava de Santiago - 26 Avenida de la Laguna
description: Free place, quiet and far from the road, there are picnic areas and barbecues, next to a beautiful pond and a playground. The best place to spend the night and spend the day if you want to make a hiking route in the area or visit the caracara dolmen. In the village you can buy bread, treats and homemade pasta for breakfast. Or go to a bar, a restaurant to eat, and on Friday night there are churros!

title: (06894) Aljucén - EX-214
description: Picnic tables near small stream and barbecue facilities. Very good Too bad no trash can.

title: (10132) Almoharín -
description: "Natural paradise of Kiko cosquilla" In our space: we are free from extremes, we share, we respect each other, we laugh, we sunbathe, we read, we tell each other stories, an incubator of ideas, we enjoy the sunset and above all we love the earth and nature. What we try to do is create a confluence place for conscientious and daring people. We have our hens that are the queens of the space, orchard, wonderful shadows, barbecue, puff, hammocks... We also have accommodation with two rooms and a super cute caravan. Location: We are in the center of Extremadura in a rural environment 5 km from our town "Almoharin" where figs and fig bonbons are our star product. Neighbors of Montanchez with a ham that takes your mind away. We can also enjoy our cities just 30 minutes from Mérida, Trujillo and Cáceres. *We do breakfast on weekends. *Natural breads with slow fermentation (by order) *Eggs from our hens in freedom. *Figs. *box of assorted vegetables. If you want to share, respect and feel at peace you are WELCOME.

title: (10694) Cáceres - EX-208
description: Free parking in the heart of the Monfrague Natural Park.No overnight stay

title: (06190) La Roca de la Sierra - 34 Diseminado Diseminados
title_short: (06190) La Roca de la Sierra - 34 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Large picnic area, boardwalk, game, animals, nature in its purest state ...

title: (06190) La Roca de la Sierra - EX-100
title_short: (06190) La Roca de la Sierra - EX-100
description: Not necessarily for the night but ideal to rest, shower and eat at the restaurant. Portable water tap, hot shower very clean and free, WC, small gas station.

title: (06894) Aljucén - 11 Calle San Andrés
description: Esplanade right at the entrance to the village. It is not very uneven. Next to sports facilities. There is a fountain where you can take water and a few toilets but we do not know if they will be open. Although it is close to the exit, it is very quiet. We had a good night.

name: Camping las Catalinas.
title: (10693) Camping las Catalinas.
description: Clean, small level campsite with large sections under the trees. A few permanent campers are here. There is a restaurant, a small bar and the small town is only a few hundred meters away. The toilets are very well maintained and clean! There is also a washing machine and a place to empty the chemical toilets. Water and sewer supply is of course also available.

title: (10695) Serradilla - EX-208
description: Great parking next to the road and the river and with covered picnic areas where you can enjoy the wonderful views.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - N-630
description: Rest area without services, excellent for resting overnight and following the route

title: (10829) Riolobos - CC-5.4
description: Hidden place by the river. Visible from the street, but little traffic.

title: (10883) Portaje - 37 Barrio Laguna
description: Municipal motorhome area. Water and electricity at the price of 1 euro. Direct payment at terminal. Free parking in the surroundings.

title: (06800) Urbanización de Proserpina -
description: Another spot in the area. Slightly oblique. Driveway partially heavily washed out. Good internet reception. A few cyclists and hikers during the day, also during the week. Nice environment.

title: (06800) Mérida - Calle de Santiago
description: Much quieter place than down by the lake. 4x4 not necessary, is also feasible with a van. Very quiet!

title: (06800) Mérida - Calle de Santiago
description:
Nothing just a nature 
We spent a night here in January 
No 4×4 needed.
